problem_text:
Let r(m) = {r+km | k ∈ Z} for integers 0 ⩽ r < m. For r1(m1)∩r2(m2) = ∅ define the class transposition τr1(m1),r2(m2) as the involution which interchanges r1 + km1 and r2 + km2 for each integer k and fixes everything else.
The group CT(Z) generated by all class transpositions is simple (Math. Z., 264, no. 4 (2010), 927–938). Is Out(CT(Z)) = ⟨σ 7→σn7→−n−1⟩∼= C2?
S. Kohl
